title.narrative: Provision of life-saving primary and secondary healthcare services for the most vulnerable communities in the Gaza Strip and Area C of the West Bank

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to ensure access to life-saving primary and secondary healthcare services for the most vulnerable communities of oPt. In Gaza, WHO will use CERF to procure and distribute essential medical supplies and support minor upgrades of emergency departments to ensure gender-sensitive admissions in four out of seven major trauma hospitals located in critical areas. In the West Bank, WHO will provide integrated primary healthcare and referral services in 19 prioritized communities through mobile health clinics and train local community members on first aid. An estimated 222,011 people, including 210,000 in Gaza and 12,011 in the West Bank, will benefit from this project, which will be implemented over about nine months.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: An estimated 12,011 affected people living in 19 communities in Area C of the West Bank have improved access to integrated essential life-saving primary health care services.
